title.narrative: Localization of Aid

description.narrative: Development Expertise Center (DEC) in collaboration with the Ethiopian Civil Society Organization’s Council (ECSOC) organized dialogue forums on the localization of aid in Ethiopia. Local NGOs inadvertently contributors to the repression of freedom of speech in the community, it is planned to influence ING, donors and government to shift the power. Therefore, the forum intended to influence in-country development actors (government, international NGOs and individual donors) to support community philanthropy and localization of aid. The rationale behind this call was to support community philanthropy and to share awareness of the concept of localization of aid in Ethiopia which pave the way to materialize the localization of aid. The forum and the established platform were encouraging to put into practice localization of aid in Ethiopia which DEC and consortium members established good relationships with ECSOC, CSOs and the Authority of Civil Society Organization (ACSO).

participating-org.narrative: Consortium of Ethiopian Human Right Organizations (CEHRO)
Consortium of Self Help Approach Promoters (CoSAP)

activity-date.narrative: The rationale behind the forum was to support community philanthropy, to share experiences and raise awareness on the concept of localization of aid in Ethiopia to Civil Society Actors’ (CSAs) which pave the way to materialize localization of aid. The dependency of local NGOs on foreign funding leads to a loss of local legitimacy. Civil Society Actors (CSAs) tend to become closer to donors than the local communities which they were established to represent and serve. This upward accountability to donors hampers fulfillment of local communities’ priority needs which inadvertently contributes to infringing civic rights and erodes local communities’ freedom of speech in “Community/Society” civicus as passive recipients of aid. Therefore, considering the prevailing challenges, localization of aid strategy dialogue forum organized by both parties to materialize the agenda in the country by inviting Government co signatories(GOs), Local Non-Governmental Organizations (LNGOs), International Non-governmental Organizations (INGOs) and Community of Practices (CoP) in reshaping the current funding strategies and restore freedom of speech, particularly on who defines priorities for local action which has asymmetric power relationship among community, local actors and donor including magnitude of funding goes to community development.

description.narrative: In the central domain we aim to unlock the collective power of local communities represented by Civil Society Actors (CSAs: community organisations movements informal groups and human rights defenders) to express their opinion through community philanthropy.

D3.a International donors support community philanthropy as a strategy for increasing the political dimension of CSA work from a base of increased ownership and legitimacy

description.narrative: In the third domain we challenge and change the existing practices of international foundations INGOs and bi- and multilateral donors in working with southern CSAs. We will advocate to put community philanthropy at the heart of their funding policy and to focus (more) on brokering diplomacy and technical expertise roles.

title.narrative: # of #ShiftThePower local national and international actors in mainstream development spaces.
G. An equal and just society where civic space is open: all citizens can express their views and opinions freely organize themselves and exercise their rights.

description.narrative: Strategic objective: to enhance freedom of speech (both as a means and an end) by amplifying community voices claiming their rights towards power-holders through community philanthropy with the support of other state and societal actors in 8 countries.

title.narrative: The extent to which people feel they have the freedom to express their views and opinions freely including people with possibly different perspectives such as on equality regarding gender age living with disability marginalised groups ethnicity religion etc.

P4. Learning and innovation: Learning and Innovation is the engine behind all cooperation. Attention to learning and innovation in all building blocks will lead to more positive results and added value.
Extent to which the GfC Partnership ensures a true learning environment including a space for trust among the partners and enables continuous learning and adaption’.

P2. Shifting the power in the steering structure: The steering structure is a particular form of steering order as to organise predictable behaviour on communication and interaction between the different partners of this programme and the objective is to increase equal powerrelations and follow the #ShiftThePower principles within the partnership.
Extent to which the GfC steering structure is able to shift the power within the programme years and be inclusive towards all partners’.

Extent to which the Giving for Change Partnership acknowledges and builds on strengths of each alliance member and partner’.
